titleStmt.title: I'm ceded -- I've stopped being Their's --

publicationStmt.p: The Poems of Emily Dickinson, Johnson, 1955

lg.l: I'm ceded -- I've stopped being Their's --
The name They dropped upon my face
With water, in the country church
Is finished using, now,
And They can put it with my Dolls,
My childhood, and the string of spools,
I've finished threading -- too --
Baptized, before, without the choice,
But this time, consciously, of Grace --
Unto supremest termterm name --
Called to my Full -- The Crescent dropped --
Existence's whole EyeEye Rim (crossed out)Rim (crossed out) Arc, filled up,
With just onejust one one small Diadem.
My second Rank -- too small the first --
Crowned -- whimperingwhimpering danglingdangling Crowing -- on my Father's breast --
An insufficient Queen --An insufficient Queen -- A too unconscioustoo unconscious half unconscious Queen --
But this time -- Adequate -- Erect,
With powerpower Will to choose, or to reject,
And I choose, just a ThroneThrone Crown --
12.whole Arc] surmise (crossed out)
